channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023071131
item.description:
Report X-2023071131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED NOTICEABLY WET AND A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED CONTENTS INSIDE CONSISTED OF 2 RAPICIDE PA PART A (FULLY REGULATED) AND 2 RAPICIDE PART B (NON-HAZ) THAT LEAKED INTERNALLY DUE TO LOSE BOTTLE CAPS. 2X5 LITERS OF PART A FAILED CAUSING ENTIRE PACKAGE TO FAIL. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2023070956
item.description:
Report X-2023070956

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic jerrican began leaking during unloading at the facility. Item may have been damaged prior to arrival at our facility. Can was placed into a plastic hazmat tote and moved to the damage area. Spilled liquid was cleaned up with absorbent pads. DescribePack: Small puncture on bottom of plastic can at the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery the can was placed into a plastic hazmat tote and the spilled liquid was cleaned up with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023070952
item.description:
Report X-2023070952

  • City: KOKOMO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: odor coming from the box. upon opening the package, a very small leak had occured at the cap DescribePack: Lid was lose on 1 bottle of corrosive cleaner. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: absorbant material was used to dry up the leak and tighted the cap.

item.title: Report X-2023061462
item.description:
Report X-2023061462

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: WESTVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE SOUND OF RATTLING AEROSOL CANS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE PRECISION COLOR. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023061333
item.description:
Report X-2023061333

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A leaking package was discovered at the INDH facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained a metal drum that had a damaged bottom chime. The package was place into a steel salvage package and a nwe declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023061330
item.description:
Report X-2023061330

  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN

  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 8 the package was discovered to be leaking. The package was marked as a Class 3 Flammable Liquid. DG Admin instructed the station to place the package into a steel salvage drum and contact the shipper to have this sent out for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070711
item.description:
Report E-2023070711

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the cap was loose on one of the poly 55 gallon drum of carusol (un3214) and that 2 ounces had been released due to improper preparation for shipping. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
